code-samples.label: cURL
code-samples.code:
curl -X 'GET' \
  'https://api.xwallet.com/api/v1/wallets/{wallet_id}' \
  -H 'X-API-KEY: AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'X-Signature: SIGNATURE' \
  -H 'X-Timestamp: TIMESTAMP' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'

parameters.description: Get an existing wallet, or create a new one if doesn't exist. It's two separate functions in the libs.
parameters.name: get_if_exists

schema.description: Get an existing wallet, or create a new one if doesn't exist. It's two separate functions in the libs.

code-samples.name: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
code-samples.code:
wallet_out = xwallet.wallet.create(WalletIn(
    name="My first wallet",
    uid="unique-wallet-identifier"
), None)

code-samples.name: Python (Async)
code-samples.code:
wallet_out = await xwallet.wallet.create(WalletIn(
    name="My first wallet",
    uid="unique-wallet-identifier"
), None)

code-samples.name: Go
Java
code-samples.code:
WalletOut walletOut = xwallet.getWallet().create(new WalletIn()
    .name("My first wallet")
    .uid("unique-wallet-identifier")
)

code-samples.name: Rust
C#
cURL
code-samples.code:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://api.xwallet.io/api/v1/wallets' \
  -H 'X-API-KEY: AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'X-Signature: SIGNATURE' \
  -H 'X-Timestamp: TIMESTAMP' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
        "name": "My first wallet",
        "uid": "unique-wallet-identifier"
    }'

code-samples.label: cURL
code-samples.code:
curl -X 'GET' \
  'https://api.xwallet.com/api/v1/accounts/{account_id}' \
  -H 'X-API-KEY: AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'X-Signature: SIGNATURE' \
  -H 'X-Timestamp: TIMESTAMP' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'

parameters.description: Get an existing account, or create a new one if doesn't exist. It's two separate functions in the libs.
parameters.name: get_if_exists

schema.description: Get an existing account, or create a new one if doesn't exist. It's two separate functions in the libs.

code-samples.name: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python (Async)
code-samples.code:
account_out = await xwallet.account.create(AccountIn(
    walletId="wallet_1srOrx2ZWZBpBUvZwXKQmoEYga2",
    currency="USDT",
    uid="unique-account-identifier"
), None)

code-samples.name: Go
Rust
C#
cURL
code-samples.code:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://api.xwallet.io/api/v1/accounts' \
  -H 'X-API-KEY: AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'X-Signature: SIGNATURE' \
  -H 'X-Timestamp: TIMESTAMP' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
        "wallet_id": "wallet_1srOrx2ZWZBpBUvZwXKQmoEYga2",
        "currency": "USDT",
        "uid": "unique-wallet-identifier"
    }'

code-samples.label: cURL
code-samples.code:
curl -X 'GET' \
  'https://api.xwallet.com/api/v1/addresses/{address_id}' \
  -H 'X-API-KEY: AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'X-Signature: SIGNATURE' \
  -H 'X-Timestamp: TIMESTAMP' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'

parameters.description: Get an existing address, or create a new one if doesn't exist. It's two separate functions in the libs.
parameters.name: get_if_exists

schema.description: Get an existing address, or create a new one if doesn't exist. It's two separate functions in the libs.

code-samples.name: JavaScript
TypeScript
Python
code-samples.code:
address_out = xwallet.address.create(AddressIn(
    accountId="account_2srOrx2ZWZBpBUvZwXKQmoEYga2",
    chain="ERC20",
    token="USDT",
    uid="unique-address-identifier"
), None)

code-samples.name: Python (Async)
code-samples.code:
address_out = await xwallet.address.create(AddressIn(
    accountId="account_2srOrx2ZWZBpBUvZwXKQmoEYga2",
    chain="ERC20",
    token="USDT",
    uid="unique-address-identifier"
), None)

code-samples.name: Go
Rust
C#
cURL
code-samples.code:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://api.xwallet.io/api/v1/addresses' \
  -H 'X-API-KEY: AUTH_TOKEN' \
  -H 'X-Signature: SIGNATURE' \
  -H 'X-Timestamp: TIMESTAMP' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
        "account_id": "account_2srOrx2ZWZBpBUvZwXKQmoEYga2",
        "chain": "ERC20",
        "token": "USDT",
        "uid": "unique-address-identifier"
    }'

ValidationError.description: Validation errors have their own schema to provide context for invalid requests eg. mismatched types and out of bounds values. There may be any number of these per 422 UNPROCESSABLE ENTITY error.

loc.description: The location as a [`Vec`] of [`String`]s -- often in the form `["body", "field_name"]`, `["query", "field_name"]`, etc. They may, however, be arbitrarily deep.

msg.description: The message accompanying the validation error item.

type.description: The type of error, often "type_error" or "value_error", but sometimes with more context like as "value_error.number.not_ge"

uid.description: Optional unique identifier for the wallet
Optional unique identifier for the account
Optional unique identifier for the address
